question: Phase 4 clinical trials is carried out:
exp: A new drug/ vaccine is launched in the market after phase III (RCT). Phase IV is 'Post marketing surveillance phase' Is the longest phase in a clinical trial. Should be carried out life long (minimum 10-25 years). Is done for finding 'long term side effects and rare side effects' of the drug.
opa: Before the marketing approval of a drug
opc: For drugs used in rare disease
opd: For drugs used in pediatric patients

question: Efficacy of new drug A is compared with an existing drug B in:

question: Maximum tolerated dose of a new drug is evaluated in:
exp: Phase 1 clinical trial: Used to evaluate Maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of a new drug. Healthy human volunteers are used. Done for safety and non-toxicity.

question: Father of Evidence Based Medicine is:
exp: Father of Evidence based medicine (EBM): David Lawrence Sackett founded first Depament of Clinical Epidemiology in Canada, founded Oxford Centre for EBM Wrote books: Clinical Epidemiology Evidence Based Medicine

question: In a Prospective study, 1200 patient were randomly selected to study the effect of a New drug. The drug will be given for 5 years and its association with cataract will be studied. What type of study is this?
exp: If you are giving a drug so it is a experimental study or trial If we have a comparison group in which you give some other drug or placebo then also it is randomized clinical trial Heart of RCT- Randomization ( applied while allocating them or dividing them into reference group.) Equal & known chance is present.
